content: into the woods is created using the overlay mosaic technique these are 6 separate patterns that can be used in any project you like but they do fit into sholach perfectly if you would like to add a row of log cabins or tents into your project the pdf has 6 easy to read charts with x s for dcs for each pattern included and corresponding written instructions there are 3 log cabin patterns and three tent patterns two pdf s are available - one using us terms and one using uk terms *********************************************************** if you are going to use these in sholach remember that these are a 48-stitch repeat whereas sholach is a 24-stitch repeat so ensure your starting chain on sholach is divisible by 48 the main sholach pattern is a starting chain of 196 24 x 8 plus 4 so these patterns will repeat in sholach 4 times across you can purchase sholach from my ravelry store if you haven t already https //ravel me/sholach-mosaic-christmas-trees ****************************************************** i haven t given any yarn stats for these since they are just small patterns if you re using these in sholach it is up to you which patterns you decide to replace with these you can use any yarn and corresponding hook you like for this pattern just remember a tighter gauge is better for mosaic crochet you can include these patterns in any of your overlay mosaic projects but please do credit me when posting pictures happy crocheting abi
